sen.j: 伝承によれば13世紀頃、南宋鎮江（現中華人民共和国江蘇省鎮江）の径山寺で作られていた、刻んだ野菜を味噌につけ込む金山寺味噌の製法を、紀伊国（和歌山県）の由良町興国寺の開祖法燈円明國師（ほうとうえんめいこくし）が日本に伝え、湯浅町周辺で金山寺味噌作りが広まった。
sen.e: According to the story, the manufacturing method of kinzanji miso (chunky barley miso conserve); miso (soybean paste) mixed with chopped vegetables, which was made in Jngshan Temple in 鎮江, Southern Sung (present day 鎮江, Jiangsu Province, China), was introduced to Japan by Hotoenmei-kokushi, a founder of Kokoku-ji Temple in Yura Town, Kii Province (Wakayama prefecture) around the thirteenth century, and production of kinzanji miso started around Yuasa Town.

tit.j: 基本的な製造法（本醸造・こいくちしょうゆ）

sen.j: 現在、国内で生産されている醤油の大半が本醸造であり、また濃口が大半を占める。
sen.e: Soy-sauce produced within the nation is mainly honjozo (authentically-brewed), and Dark-colored soy-sauce makes up most of it.

sen.cmt: 既出単語の補足を削除しました。

sen.j: 「本醸造」の条件は、大豆、麦、米等の穀物を蒸煮し、麹菌を用いて作成した麹に、塩水または生揚げを混合して発酵・熟成させたものを指す。
sen.e: `Honjozo' (authentically-brewed) refers to rice malt which was created using Aspergillus oryzae after steaming crops including soybeans, wheat, and rice, mixed with salt water or deep-fried bean curd for ferment and maturation.

`Honjozo' (authentically-brewed) refers to rice malt which was created using Aspergillus oryzae after steaming crops including soybeans, wheat, and rice, mixed with salt water or deep-fried bean curd for ferment and maturation.

The condition of 'honjozo' includes that rice malt which was created using Aspergillus oryzae after steaming crops including soybeans, wheat and rice, is mixed with salt water or kiage (raw soy sauce) for ferment and maturation.
sen.cmt: 既出単語の補足を削除しました。The condition of 'honjozo' includes that としました。生揚げ→kiage (raw soy-sauce) に変更しました。

sen.j: 麹に、蒸した米や甘酒を添加したり、分解を促進するための、セルラーゼ等の酵素を添加することも許されている。
sen.e: Adding steamed rice or sweet sake or enzyme such as cellulose in order to facilitate decomposition to rice malt is allowed.
Adding steamed rice or sweet sake or enzyme such as cellulose in order to facilitate decomposition to rice malt is allowed.
Adding steamed rice or sweet sake or enzyme such as cellulose in order to facilitate decomposition to rice malt is allowed.

sen.j: ただしプロテアーゼを除く。
sen.e: Protease is exception.
Protease is exception.
Protease is exception.

sen.j: JAS特級の条件には「本醸造であること」という項目も含まれているため、特級醤油であれば常に本醸造醤油である。
sen.e: Requirements for special grade by Japan Agricultural Standard contain the item of `it must be Honjozo' (authentically-brewed), which means the special grade soy-sauce must be `Honjozo' soy-sauce.

sen.j: 原料工程
sen.e: Raw material process
Raw material process
Raw material process

sen.j: 大豆（または脱脂加工大豆）は浸水し、膨潤したところで圧力をかけて蒸煮する。
sen.e: Soybeans (or defatted soybeans) are soaked, and they are steamed under pressure when they are swollen.
Soybeans (or defatted soybeans) are soaked, and they are steamed under pressure when they are swollen.
Soybeans (or defatted soybeans) are soaked, and they are steamed under pressure when they are swollen.

sen.j: 小麦は焙煎し、割砕して荒い粉末状にする。
sen.e: Wheat are smashed and made into rough flour after being roasted.
Wheat are smashed and made into rough flour after being roasted.
Wheat are smashed and made into rough flour after being roasted.

sen.j: 加熱条件には留意する。
sen.e: Pay attention to heat conditions.
Pay attention to heat conditions.
Pay attention to heat conditions.

sen.j: これは、生の大豆タンパク質が最終工程に残ると製品（加熱時）の濁りにつながり、小麦の生デンプンは、一般的な醤油酵母は資化できないためである。
sen.e: Because, remaining soybean protein in the final process leads to turbidity in products (in heating), and raw starch in wheat are unable to 資化 general soy-sauce yeasts.
sen.cmt: 資化→定訳不明のため原文のままとしています。
sen.e: Because, remaining soybean protein in the final process leads to turbidity in products (in heating), and raw starch in wheat are unable to 資化 general soy-sauce yeasts.

Because, remaining soybean protein in the final process leads to turbidity in products (in heating), and raw starch in wheat are unable to be consumed as source of nutrient by general soy-sauce yeasts.
sen.cmt: 資化する→「栄養源として利用する」との意味のようですので、左記のようにしました。（http://okwave.jp/qa/q4135572.html）

sen.j: 製造工程
sen.e: Production process
Production process
Production process

sen.j: 製麹（せいきく）工程 蒸煮大豆と割砕小麦を約11で混合したものに種麹を加えて混ぜ、高湿度下で3・4日程度培養を行い醤油麹を作る。
sen.e: Manufacturing process of koji (rice malt) Add seed malt to the mixture of steamed soybeans and smashed wheat with the mix ratio of 1:1, and produce soy-sauce malt through culture of it for three to four days under high humidity.
sen.cmt: 約11で混合したもの→約1:1で混合したもの と解釈し訳出しました。
sen.e: Manufacturing process of koji (rice malt) Add seed malt to the mixture of steamed soybeans and smashed wheat with the mix ratio of 1:1, and produce soy-sauce malt through culture of it for three to four days under high humidity.

sen.j: 麹菌には、主にショウユコウジカビ用いられ、ニホンコウジカビが使用されることもある。

sen.j: 仕込工程（前期） 醤油麹に塩水を加え、麹の塊を崩して混合しながら醸造タンクに移送することを「仕込工程」と呼ぶ。
sen.e: Preparation process (the early stage) It is referred to as the `preparation process' to add salt water to soy-sauce malt, and to move it to a brewing tank while breaking and mixing the whole malt.

sen.e: Enzyme from malt decomposes protein to amino acid, and decomposes starchiness to sugar.

sen.j: 仕込工程（中期） 諸味内にて微生物による発酵が起きる。
sen.e: Preparation process (the middle stage) Ferment by microorganism occurs in moromi (unrefined soy-sauce).

sen.j: まずは乳酸菌（Tetragenococcus halophilus）により乳酸が作られ、諸味全体が酸性に傾く。
sen.e: Firstly, lactic acid was generated by lactobacillus (Tetragenococcus halophilus), and the entire moromi (unrefined soy-sauce) became acidity.

sen.j: 次に、酵母（Zygosaccharomyces rouxii）により、アルコール発酵が起きる。
sen.e: Secondly, alcoholic fermentation by yeast (Zygosaccharomyces rouxii) occurs.

sen.j: また、先に挙げた酵素添加による速醸法を用いることで、1ヶ月程度に醸造期間を短縮することができる。
sen.e: When using the fast brewing method by adding enzyme that was mentioned earlier, the brewing period can be shortened to about one month.

sen.j: しかし醤油醸造は酵素反応で原料が分解されれば終了という単純なものではなく、広く使われてはいない。
sen.e: However, this method is not widely used; soy-sauce brewing is not nearly simple that the brewing is finished when raw materials are decomposed by enzyme reactions.
